item.title: Don't Call It a Cruise: 12 Truly Awesome Journeys at Sea
item.description:
Don't Call It a Cruise: 12 Truly Awesome Journeys at Sea

Small, chic ships with top-notch amenities and designed interiors are making waves in the industry.

item.title: Wearable Sun Protection
item.description:
Wearable Sun Protection

There's no faster way to throw shade on a warm weather vacation (or the first few hot days of spring) than with sunburn. It takes only 15 minutes of direct sunlight exposure for skin damage to begin occurring, so protection is a must.

item.title: 33 Women Doing Amazing Things in Graphic Design
item.description:
33 Women Doing Amazing Things in Graphic Design

These talented women have unleashed their creativity and skills on the world of graphic design. Paula Scher is an American graphic designer, illustrator, and educator, and the first female Principal at . She started experimenting with typography in the early 1980s and looked to historic design sources such as Russian Constructivism, obscure and little-used typefaces, and her seemingly unlimited imagination.
